javax.microedition.media

Interface PlayerListener


  • public interface PlayerListener
    The PlayerListener interface provides a mechanism to receive notifications about various events related to a media player. Implementations of this interface can be registered with a Player to handle these events.

    Event types include:

    • CLOSED - Indicates that the player has been closed.
    • DEVICE_AVAILABLE - Indicates that a device has become available.
    • DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE - Indicates that a device has become unavailable.
    • DURATION_UPDATED - Indicates that the duration of the media has been updated.
    • END_OF_MEDIA - Indicates that the media has reached its end.
    • ERROR - Indicates that an error has occurred.
    • STARTED - Indicates that the player has started.
    • STOPPED - Indicates that the player has stopped.
    • VOLUME_CHANGED - Indicates that the volume has changed.

    Implementations of this interface must provide the playerUpdate(Player, String, Object) method to handle these events.
